--- title: "sqlite in sqlite" author: "Cody" date: "2024-11-28" categories: - python - ibis - sqlite --- ***Storing SQLite databases in SQLite databases.*** --- In this post, we'll look at storing SQLite databases in SQLite databases. Since a SQLite database is represented by a file on disk, we can simply store the bytes of that file in a blob column in another SQLite database. We'll demonstrate this with Ibis [and some stateful packages we talked about beofre](../fast-simple-state/index.qmd): ::: {#5777dafa .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import os import ibis import ibis.expr.datatypes as dt from dkdc_util import now, uuid from dkdc_todo import Todo from dkdc_lake import Lake ibis.options.interactive = True ``` ::: Let's define the schema of our meta-database: ::: {#70ff6b96 .cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} schema = ibis.schema( { "idx": dt.timestamp, "filename": str, "data": dt.binary, } ) schema ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=2} ``` ibis.Schema { idx timestamp filename string data binary } ``` ::: ::: And create it: ::: {#34e54a0f .cell execution_count=3} ``` {.python .cell-code} # for idempotency if os.path.exists("db.db"): os.remove("db.db") dbs = ibis.sqlite.connect("db.db") dbs.create_table("dbs", schema=schema) dbs.list_tables() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=3} ``` ['dbs'] ``` ::: ::: The table is empty: ::: {#7b77ffcb .cell execution_count=4} ``` {.python .cell-code} t = dbs.table("dbs") t ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4} ```{=html} 
┏━━━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━┓
┃ idx       ┃ filename ┃ data   ┃
┡━━━━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━┩
│ timestamp │ string   │ binary │
└───────────┴──────────┴────────┘
``` ::: ::: ## creating some example SQLite databases Let's use our previously demonstrated dkdc-todo and dkdc-lake packages to quickly create a couple SQLite databases with some tables in them: ::: {#1a271f54 .cell execution_count=5} ``` {.python .cell-code} # for idempotency if os.path.exists("todo.db"): os.remove("todo.db") todo = Todo(dbpath="todo.db") for i in range(10): todo.append_todo( id=uuid(), user_id=None, subject=f"subject {i}", body=f"body {i}", ) ``` ::: We can confirm there's some data: ::: {#9710f939 .cell execution_count=6} ``` {.python .cell-code} todo.t() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=6} ```{=html} 
┏━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━┓
┃ idx                        ┃ id                       ┃ user_id ┃ subject   ┃ body   ┃ priority ┃ status ┃ description ┃ labels ┃
┡━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━┩
│ timestamp(6)               │ string                   │ string  │ string    │ string │ int64    │ string │ string      │ array… │

│ 2024-11-27 19:02:55.901437 │ 173273417590141-5b9d1bf9 │ NULL    │ subject 3 │ body 3 │      100 │ NULL   │ NULL        │ NULL   │
│ 2024-11-27 19:02:55.888691 │ 173273417588866-92e9f445 │ NULL    │ subject 2 │ body 2 │      100 │ NULL   │ NULL        │ NULL   │
│ 2024-11-27 19:02:55.875847 │ 173273417587582-c20d50d8 │ NULL    │ subject 1 │ body 1 │      100 │ NULL   │ NULL        │ NULL   │
│ 2024-11-27 19:02:55.826659 │ 173273417582662-e66d9c62 │ NULL    │ subject 0 │ body 0 │      100 │ NULL   │ NULL        │ NULL   │
└────────────────────────────┴──────────────────────────┴─────────┴───────────┴────────┴──────────┴────────┴─────────────┴────────┘
``` ::: ::: Repeat for the lake database: ::: {#9087446e .cell execution_count=7} ``` {.python .cell-code} # for idempotency if os.path.exists("lake.db"): os.remove("lake.db") lake = Lake(dbpath="lake.db") for i in range(10): lake.append_file( user_id=None, path=None, filename=f"file_{i}.txt", filetype="txt", data=b"hi", ) ``` ::: And again confirm we have data: ::: {#fa7171da .cell execution_count=8} ``` {.python .cell-code} lake.t() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=8} ```{=html} 
┏━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━┓
┃ idx                        ┃ id                       ┃ user_id ┃ path   ┃ filename   ┃ filetype ┃ data   ┃ version ┃ status ┃ description ┃ labels ┃
┡━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━┩

│ 2024-11-27 19:02:56.089828 │ 173273417608983-36480ebe │ NULL    │ NULL   │ file_1.txt │ txt      │ b'hi'  │    NULL │ NULL   │ NULL        │ NULL   │
│ 2024-11-27 19:02:56.052797 │ 173273417605280-2b0d2964 │ NULL    │ NULL   │ file_0.txt │ txt      │ b'hi'  │    NULL │ NULL   │ NULL        │ NULL   │

``` ::: ::: ## file to database Let's check the current databases we have: ::: {#f41da250 .cell execution_count=9} ``` {.python .cell-code} !ls | grep .db ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` db.db lake.db todo.db ``` ::: ::: And define some functions to read a file into bytes and insert it into the meta-database: ::: {#83035008 .cell execution_count=10} ``` {.python .cell-code} def file_to_bytes(filename: str) -> bytes: with open(filename, "rb") as f: return f.read() def insert_file_to_db(filename: str) -> None: data = { "idx": [now()], "filename": [filename], "data": [file_to_bytes(filename)], } dbs.insert("dbs", data) ``` ::: We can run this over our todo and lake databases, removing the files after copying the data: ::: {#e4b0b7c7 .cell execution_count=11} ``` {.python .cell-code} for filename in ["todo.db", "lake.db"]: insert_file_to_db(filename) os.remove(filename) ``` ::: And see that our meta-database now contains the data: ::: {#650698d0 .cell execution_count=12} ``` {.python .cell-code} t ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=12} ```{=html} 
┏━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━┓
┃ idx                        ┃ filename ┃ data                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               ┃
┡━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━━━╇━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━┩
│ timestamp                  │ string   │ binary                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             │
├────────────────────────────┼──────────┼────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│ 2024-11-27 19:02:56.686037 │ todo.db  │ b'SQLite format 3\x00\x10\x00\x01\x01\x00@  \x00\x00\x00\x0b\x00\x00\x00\x02\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x01\x00\x00\x00\x04\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x01\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00'+8112 │
│ 2024-11-27 19:02:56.693290 │ lake.db  │ b'SQLite format 3\x00\x10\x00\x01\x01\x00@  \x00\x00\x00\x0b\x00\x00\x00\x02\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x01\x00\x00\x00\x04\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x01\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00'+8112 │
└────────────────────────────┴──────────┴────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
``` ::: ::: We can also see that the original databases are gone: ::: {#d7bf79ab .cell execution_count=13} ``` {.python .cell-code} !ls | grep .db ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` db.db ``` ::: ::: ## database to file We can reverse the process to re-hydrate the todo and lake databases: ::: {#5e052328 .cell execution_count=14} ``` {.python .cell-code} for filename in t["filename"].to_pyarrow().to_pylist(): data = t.filter(t["filename"] == filename)["data"].to_pyarrow().to_pylist()[0] with open(filename, "wb") as f: f.write(data) ``` ::: And confirm the data is back: ::: {#e756bea6 .cell execution_count=15} ``` {.python .cell-code} !ls | grep .db ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` db.db lake.db todo.db ``` ::: ::: We can then re-hydrate our Python objects: ::: {#1711accd .cell execution_count=16} ``` {.python .cell-code} todo = Todo(dbpath="todo.db") todo.t() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=16} ```{=html} 
┏━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━━━━━━┳━━━━━━━━┓

``` ::: ::: ::: {#25aae1dd .cell execution_count=17} ``` {.python .cell-code} lake = Lake(dbpath="lake.db") lake.t() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=17} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ## conclusion Is this useful? Maybe. Packaging data into a single file can be useful. You'd probably want to add compression, encryption, and various other things for production.
